member.name: T:Itron.Metering.Utilities.ActivityLogEntry
member.summary: Represents a Log Item for the an Activity Log. The class contains the elements that go into an entry of the Activity Log, which are Date/Time, MeterType, UnitID, MeterSerialNumber, Event, and Data. The class contains all functionality needed to add an activity Log item.
member.example:
The strucure of the activity log is simulated below
ActivityLog Entry DateTime--Tuesday, July 05, 2005 11:36:18 AM--/DateTime MeterType--SENTINEL--/MeterType UnitID--Meter ID 1--/UnitID MeterSerialNumber--123-456-789--/MeterSerialNumber Event--Reconfigure Failed--/Event Data--Custom 1--/Data /Entry /ActivityLog

member.summary: Constructor - Sets the event time to the current time. Sets the other member variables to their empty values.
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 01/16/07 mah 8.00.00 Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Utilities.ActivityLogEntry.Add
member.summary: Adds an XmlNode to the XmlDocument for the Activity Log. Gets the application directory from the registry and then opens or creates the Activity Log xml file. Appends the new entry to the XmlDocument An XmlException is thrown if there is a problem with loading the xml file.
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 07/14/05 rrr 7.13.00 N/A Creation of class 04/25/06 mrj 7.30.00 Updated for HH-Pro 01/15/07 mah 8.00.00 Changed registry access class from CE version

members.member:
Takes the attributs of a log entry and puts them into an XmlNode. The node is then returned or null if the node was not created. An ArgumentException is thrown if an invalid node is created.

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Utilities.ActivityLog.Read(System.String)
member.summary: This method reads all of the entries in the activity log and returns them as a generic list.
member.param: This string is used to identify the file to read. The assumption is that different applications will be able to generate activity logs and that each file can be looked up using the application name as a registry key
member.returns: A generic list containing activity log items. A value of NULL will be returned if the file cannot be found. If the file does exist, but is unreadable, the returned list will be empty

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Utilities.CRC.ValidateCRC(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Validates that the CRC read from the file matches the calculated CRC. Used to validate that the file has not been corrupted. The file could be for any of the 3 micros of the OpenWay meter, so the file size can vary.
member.param: Complete path to the firmware file
member.remarks: Assumes that the CRC is located at the first 2 bytes of the file and that the 1st byte is the MSB and the 2nd byte the LSB
member.returns: True if the CRC validates. Otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Utilities.CRC.CalculateFirmwareCRCForHanActivation(System.String,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Calculates the CRC32 for a firmware file whose path is passed in. This is not a general use CRC32 because it skips over the header before starting the calculation
member.param: Path to the f/w file to be checked
member.returns: true if the CRC32 was successfully calculated; false, otherwise
member.remarks: This code is modified from a version sent by Scott Collins who implemented it for the collection engine.

The data to use to compute CRC.
member.returns: true if the CRC32 was successfully calculated; false, otherwise
member.remarks: This code is modified from a version sent by Scott Collins who implemented it for the collection engine.

member.name: T:Itron.Metering.Utilities.Logger
member.summary: General purpose log class. Can be used for logging debug info, errors, and protocol streams.

members.member:
LoggingLevels are used to initialize the Logger with the maximum level that should be included in generated log files. They are also implicitly or explicitly associated with every message written to the log file.
The higher the LoggingLevel, the more information will be included in the log file. Lower levels filter out details.
Revision History MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 06/01/06 mcm 7.30.00 N/A Created

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Utilities.Logger.LoggingLevel.NoLogging
member.summary: No data will be logged. No log file will be saved. This is the default or unitialized logger level. It doesn't make sense to initialize a logger with this level or write to it with this level.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Utilities.Logger.LoggingLevel.Minimal
member.summary: Minimal log data. No data will be added to the device objects to support FCS Reconfiguration with this logging level.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Utilities.Logger.LoggingLevel.Functional
member.summary: High level functional messages. Typically device driver messages like Updating DST. This level of logging includes all Minimal log level messages.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Utilities.Logger.LoggingLevel.Detailed
member.summary: Errors and details of functions. This level of logging includes all Functional log level messages.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Utilities.Logger.LoggingLevel.Protocol
member.summary: Full protocol stream. This level of logging includes all Detailed log level messages.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Utilities.Logger.LoggingLevel.ZigBeeProtocol
member.summary: All ZigBee communcation with the radio. This level of logging includes all Protocol log level messages. This level of logging includes all ZigBee/C177 profile wrapping and all primatives sent back and forth to the radio. This level makes Protocol level look concise.

members.member:
Enumerates protocol message marking for easier interpretation.
Revision History MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 06/01/06 mcm 7.30.00 N/A Created

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Utilities.Logger.ProtocolDirection.Send
member.summary: Sent data will be prepended with a "(S) " to ease interpretation.

member.name: F:Itron.Metering.Utilities.Logger.ProtocolDirection.Receive
member.summary: Sent data will be prepended with a "(R) " to ease interpretation.

members.member:
Enumerates the two possible actions to be performed on closing.
The logger should always be closed by the managing client. If the client dies a horrible death, the logger's destructor will attempt to close and write the file as marches towards that final sunset.
Revision History MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 06/01/06 mcm 7.30.00 N/A Created

member.name: T:Itron.Metering.Utilities.MeterActivityLog
member.summary: This is a singleton class that represents a persistent log of meter related events. The actual log file encapsilated by this class is an MS Access file internally accessed via OLE DB.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Utilities.MeterActivityLog.Instance
member.summary:
The meter activity log class is a singleton class. This means that only one instance of the class can be created and used per process. Note that this class is NOT threadsafe so extreme care must be taken if used in a multi-threaded application.
All access to the activity log class must be made through this property.
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 04/04/08 MAH Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Utilities.MeterActivityLog.Open
member.summary: This method is responsible for opening a connection to the activity log database. Note that this method is a fairly expensive operation in terms of time and, while DB connections are also rare commodities, applications must be concious of the trade off between performance and resource management when maintaining database connections.
member.exception: OLEDBExceptions and IO exceptions can be thrown by this method
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 04/04/08 MAH Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Utilities.MeterActivityLog.Add(Itron.Metering.Utilities.MeterActivityLogEntry)
member.summary: This method adds a single activity log entry to the database. Note that this method will not throw exceptions but will simply return a value of 'false' if the given log entry cannot be added to the event log. However, since the user will be notified via a Message Box, it is imperative that this method not be used in a background process.
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 04/04/08 MAH Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Utilities.MeterActivityLog.Read
member.summary: This method is responsible for reading the entire activity log contents and returning them as a list of log entries
member.exception: OLEDBExceptions and IO exceptions can be thrown by this method
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 04/04/08 MAH Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Utilities.MeterActivityLog.Merge(System.String)
member.summary: This method is responible for adding all of the event log records found in the given database file to the current meter activity log. No changes will be made to the incoming database file.
member.exception: OLEDBExceptions and IO exceptions can be thrown by this method
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 04/04/08 MAH Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Utilities.MeterActivityLog.RollOffEvents(System.DateTime)
member.summary: This method permanently deletes any event records that are older than the given date/time
member.exception: OLEDBExceptions and IO exceptions can be thrown by this method
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 04/04/08 MAH Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Utilities.MeterActivityLog.Close
member.summary: Closes the OLE DB connection to the activity log database
member.exception: OLEDBExceptions and IO exceptions can be thrown by this method
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 04/04/08 MAH Created

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Utilities.MeterActivityLog.ActivityLogFile
member.summary: This read-only property returns the full path name of the activity log file. It is useful when client applications want to make copies of the log file for exports or back-ups.
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 04/04/08 MAH Created

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Utilities.MeterActivityLog.FilterByDate
member.summary: This boolean property is used to enable/disable filtering of the event log by start and stop dates. If this property is set to true then the 'Read' method will only return event log entries that are between the values of the start and stop date properties.
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 04/04/08 MAH Created

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Utilities.MeterActivityLog.FilterStartDate
member.summary: This property is used in conjunction with the FilterByDate property. If the FilterByDate property is set to true, then this property establishes the date of the earliest event log record that can be returned by a call to the 'Read' method.
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 04/04/08 MAH Created

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Utilities.MeterActivityLog.FilterEndDate
member.summary: This property is used in conjunction with the FilterByDate property. If the FilterByDate property is set to true, then this property establishes the date of the latest event log record that can be returned by a call to the 'Read' method.
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 04/04/08 MAH Created

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Utilities.MeterActivityLog.ApplicationFilter
member.summary: This boolean property is used to enable/disable filtering of the event log by the name of the calling application. If this property is set to true then the 'Read' method will only return event log entries that were created by the calling application.
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 04/04/08 MAH Created

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Utilities.MeterActivityLog.FilterByResult
member.summary: This boolean property is used to enable/disable filtering of the event log by the result of the event If this property is set to true, then the 'Read' method will only return event log entries that were unsuccessful.
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 04/04/08 MAH Created

member.name: T:Itron.Metering.Utilities.VersionChecker
member.summary: This class provides helper functions for use in verifying firmware versions. Version numbers are typically provided as floating point values and simple comparisions of floating point values can be problematic. These methods take advantage of the fixed format of version numbers and provide safer methods for comparison

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Utilities.VersionChecker.CompareTo(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: This comparision method allows the caller to specify the tolerance used when comparing two floating point values. If the difference between the two values is within the given tolerance than the values are assumed to be equal although the actual floating point values may not be
member.param: The version number as returned by the file or device that is to be validated
The fixed or target version number that the file or device is being compared to.
The maximum allowable difference between the two version numbers that can exist while still considering the two numbers to be equal
member.returns: Returns -1 if the current version is less than the target Returns 0 if the current version is equal to the target Returns 1 if the current version is greater than the target
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 06/26/08 mah Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Utilities.VersionChecker.CompareTo(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Compares the two double values to see if they are equal within the given tolerance
member.param: The tolerance allowed for the values to be equal
member.returns: -1 if the first value is less than second. 1 if the first value is greater than the second. 0 if the first and second are within the specified tolerance

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Utilities.VersionChecker.CompareTo(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns -1 if the current version is less than the target Returns 0 if the current version is equal to the target Returns 1 if the current version is greater than the target This comparison method should be used to compare version numbers with the format of #.### If more or less precision is required, a different tolerance should be used.
member.param: The version number as returned by the file or device that is to be validated
The fixed or target version number that the file or device is being compared to.
member.returns: Returns -1 if the current version is less than the target Returns 0 if the current version is equal to the target Returns 1 if the current version is greater than the target
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 06/26/08 mah Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Utilities.VersionChecker.CompareTo(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: This comparison method should be used to compare version numbers with the format of #.### If more or less precision is required, a different tolerance should be used.
member.param: The version number as returned by the file or device that is to be validated
The fixed or target version number that the file or device is being compared to.
member.returns: Returns -1 if the current version is less than the target Returns 0 if the current version is equal to the target Returns 1 if the current version is greater than the target
member.remarks: Revision History MM/DD/YY Who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ ------------------------------------------- 09/18/14 jrf Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Utilities.VersionChecker.CompareTo(System.Single,System.Byte,System.Single,System.Byte)
member.summary: This comparison method can be used to compare version, revision and build values.
member.param: The version number as returned by the file or device that is to be validated.
The build number as returned by the file or device that is to be validated.
The fixed or target version number that the file or device is being compared to.
The fixed or target build number that the file or device is being compared to.
member.returns: -1 if the current is less than target. 1 if the current is greater than the target. 0 if the current and target are equal
